create_buckets_intro: Mantle SDS uses buckets to organize objects. A bucket is similar to a folder or directory in a filesystem, where each bucket can hold an arbitrary number of objects.
versioning_info: allows to keep multiple versions of the same object under the same key.
object_locking_info: prevents objects from being deleted. Required to support retention and legal hold. Can only be enabled at bucket creation.
quota_info: limits the amount of data in the bucket.
retention_info: imposes rules to prevent object deletion for a period of time. Versioning must be enabled in order to set bucket retention policies.
features_unavailable: These features are unavailable in a single-disk setup.
no_buckets_match: No buckets match the filtering condition
bucket_name_length_rule: Bucket names must be between 3 (min) and 63 (max) characters long.
bucket_name_char_rule: Bucket names can consist only of lowercase letters, numbers, dots (.), and hyphens (-).
bucket_name_period_rule: Bucket names must not contain two adjacent periods, or a period adjacent to a hyphen.
bucket_name_ip_rule: Bucket names must not be formatted as an IP address (for example, 192.168.5.4).
bucket_name_prefix_rule: Bucket names must not start with the prefix xn--.
bucket_name_suffix_rule: Bucket names must not end with the suffix -s3alias. This suffix is reserved for access point alias names.
bucket_name_unique_rule: Bucket names must be unique within a partition.
name: Name
prefix_tooltip: Leave this field blank to apply the rule to all prefixes and objects at the bucket root. Do not include the wildcard asterisk ``*`` as part of the prefix *unless* it is an explicit part of the prefix name. The Console automatically appends an asterisk to the appropriate sections of the resulting IAM policy.
delete_access_rule_message: Are you sure you want to delete this access rule?
create_user_info1: A Mantle SDS user consists of a unique access key (username) and corresponding secret key (password). Clients must authenticate their identity by specifying both a valid access key (username) and the corresponding secret key (password) of an existing Mantle SDS user.
create_user_info2: Groups provide a simplified method for managing shared permissions among users with common access patterns and workloads.
create_user_info3: Users inherit access permissions to data and resources through the groups they belong to.
create_user_info4: Mantle SDS uses Policy-Based Access Control (PBAC) to define the authorized actions and resources to which an authenticated user has access. Each policy describes on  or more actions and conditions that outline the permissions of a user or group of users.
create_user_info5: Each user can access only those resources and operations which are explicitly granted by the built-in role. Mantle SDS denies access to any other resource or action by default.
password_not_long_enough: Passwords must be at least 8 characters long
policy_search_placeholder: Start typing to search for a Policy
group_search_placeholder: Start typing to search for a Group
learn_more_users_feature: Learn more about the Users feature
delete_logged_in_error: Cannot delete currently logged in user
are_you_sure_delete: Are you sure you want to delete the following
delete_user_service_account_associated_d: Click on a user to view the full listing of asociated Service Accounts. All Service Accounts associated with a user will be deleted along with the user. Are you sure you want to continue?
warning_user_selected_has_service_accoun: Warning: One or more users selected has associated Service Accounts.
are_you_sure_delete_service_account: Are you sure you want to delete service account
are_you_sure_delete_selected: Are you sure you want to delete the selected
following_details: has been created with the following details
please_login_configured_identity_provide: Please Login via the configured external identity provider.
write_these_down_only_time_displayed: Write these down, as this is the only time the secret will be displayed.
download_credentials_json_details: Download credentials in a JSON file formatted for import using mc alias import. This will only include the default login credentials.
download_all_access_credentials_to_json: Download all access credentials to a JSON file. NOTE: This file is not formatted for import using mc alias import. If you plan to import this alias from the file, please use the Download for Import button.
adding_groups_IAM: Adding groups lets you assign IAM policies to multiple users at once.
users_inherit_access_permissions: Users inherit access permissions to data and resources through the groups they belong to.
user_multiple_groups: A user can be a member of multiple groups.
groups_simplified_method_managing: Groups provide a simplified method for managing shared permissions among users with common access patterns and workloads. Clientâ€™s cannot authenticate to a Mantle SDS deployment using a group as an identity.
select_from_the_list_of_user_to_assign_g: Select from the list of displayed users to assign users to the new group at creation. These users inherit the policies assigned to the group.
assign_IAM_policies_for_groups: Assign Custom IAM Policies for Group
add_polices_to_group: You can add policies to the group by selecting it from the Groups view after creation. The Policy view lets you manage the assigned policies for the group.
group_IAM_info: A group can have one attached IAM policy, where all users with membership in that group inherit that policy. Groups support more simplified management of user permissions on the Mantle SDS Tenant.
new_password_write_down: This will change your Console password. Please note your new password down, as it will be required to log into Console after this session.
service_accounts_info: Mantle SDS service accounts are child identities of an authenticated Mantle SDS user, including externally managed identities. Each service account inherits its privileges based on the policies attached to itâ€™s parent user or those groups in which the parent user has membership. Service accounts also support an optional inline policy which further restricts access to a subset of actions and resources available to the parent user.
service_accounts_info2: Service Accounts inherit the policies explicitly attached to the parent user, and the policies attached to each group in which the parent user has membership.
randomized_acces_credentials_are_recomme: Randomized access credentials are recommended, and provided by default. You may use your own custom Access Key and Secret Key by replacing the default values. After creation of any Service Account, you will be given the opportunity to view and download the account credentials.
service_accounts_programmatic_access: Service Accounts support programmatic access by applications. You cannot use a Service Account to log into the Mantle SDS Console.
specify_optional_json_IAM_policy: You can specify an optional JSON-formatted IAM policy to further restrict Service Account access to a subset of the actions and resources explicitly allowed for the parent user. Additional access beyond that of the parent user cannot be implemented through these policies.
cannot_modify_option_json_IAM: You cannot modify the optional Service Account IAM policy after saving.
restrict_beyond_user_policy_tooltip: You can specify an optional JSON-formatted IAM policy to further restrict Service Account access to a subset of the actions and resources explicitly allowed for the parent user. Additional access beyond that of the parent user cannot be implemented through these policies.
current_user_policy: Current User Policy - edit the JSON to remove permissions for this service account
PBAC_info: Mantle SDS Console uses Policy-Based Access Control (PBAC) to define the authorized actions and resources to which an authenticated user has access. Each policy describes one or more actions and conditions that outline the permissions of a user or group of users.
AWS_IAM_compatibility: Mantle SDS Console is built for compatibility with AWS IAM policy syntax, structure, and behavior.
acces_based_on_roles: Each user can access only those resources and operations which are explicitly granted by the built-in role. MinIO denies access to any other resource or action by default.
are_you_sure_delete_policy: Are you sure you want to delete policy
